servinfo.title: DTC P0031 / P0032: HO2S Heater Control Circuit Low / High (Sensor-1, Bank-1)

entry.ptxt: Power supply circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater
Power supply circuit of HO2S heater relay
Control circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater
Ground circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater
Ground circuit of HO2S heater relay coil
To A/F sensor (bank-2), HO2S (bank-1 and -2) (if equipped)
Power supply circuit of HO2S heater relay coil

attention3.ptxt: When DTC P0031, P0037, P0051 and P0057 are indicated together, it is possible that HO2S heater relay circuit wire is open or short to ground.
When DTC P0032, P0052 are indicated together, it is possible that A/F sensor heater ground circuit is open or high resistance.

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: DTC P0031 HOS Heater Control Circuit Low (Sensor-1, Bank-1):

entry.ptxt: Circuit current of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater is lower than 0.8 A for more than 4 sec. continuously while control duty ratio of A/F sensor heater is more than 22% with engine running.

ptxt.emph: DTC P0032 HOS Heater Control Circuit High (Sensor-1, Bank-1):

entry.ptxt: Circuit current of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater is higher than 10.5 A at ON duty pulse or 0.8 A at OFF duty pulse for more than 4 sec. continuously while control duty ratio of A/F sensor heater is more than 22% with engine running.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool to DLC.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Run engine at idle speed for 1 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to “Engine and Emission Control System Check”.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from A/F sensor (bank-1) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper terminal connection to A/F sensor (bank-1) connector.
If connections are OK, measure circuit voltage between “Power supply circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.title: HO2S heater fuse check
testgroup.question: Is “O2 HTR” fuse in good condition?

testgroup.title: HO2S heater relay power circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from each A/F sensor and HO2S with ignition switch turned OFF.
Remove HO2S heater relay (integration type relay) (1) and then check for proper terminal connection to relay connector.
If connections are OK, check that HO2S heater relay circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Insulation resistance between “Power supply circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” and vehicle body ground is infinity.
Insulation resistance between “Power supply circuit of HO2S heater relay” and vehicle body ground is infinity.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wiring harness.

testgroup.title: A/F sensor and HO2S heater resistance check

test1.ptxt: Check heater resistance of each A/F sensor and HO2S referring to Air Fuel Ratio (A/F) Sensor On-Vehicle Inspection and Heated Oxygen Sensor (HO2S-2) Heater On-Vehicle Inspection (If Equipped) .

testgroup.question: Are each A/F sensor heater and HO2S heater in good condition?

action.ptxt: Faulty HO2S heater relay. Check HO2S heater relay referring to Engine and Emission Control System Relay Inspection .

testgroup.title: HO2S heater relay power circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from each A/F sensor and HO2S with ignition switch turned OFF.
Remove HO2S heater relay (integration type relay) (1) and then check for proper terminal connection to relay connector.
If connections are OK, check that HO2S heater relay circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Circuit voltage between “Power supply circuit of HO2S heater relay” and vehicle body ground is battery voltage with ignition switch turned ON.
Circuit voltage between “Power supply circuit of HO2S heater relay coil” and vehicle body ground is battery voltage with ignition switch turned ON.
Wiring harness resistance of each “Ground circuit of HO2S heater relay coil” and “Power supply circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” is less than 1 Ω.

testgroup.question: Are they in good condition?

action.ptxt: Faulty HO2S heater relay. Check HO2S heater relay referring to Engine and Emission Control System Relay Inspection .
Repair or replace defective wiring harness.

test1.ptxt: Check that A/F sensor heater control circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Circuit voltage between “Control circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” and vehicle body ground is 0 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: repair or replace defective wiring harness.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors form ECM and check for proper terminal connection to ECM connector.
If connections are OK, check that A/F sensor heater circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between “Control circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” terminal and each other terminal at A/F sensor (bank-1) connector.
Wiring harness resistance of “Control circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” and “Control ground circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” is less than 1 Ω.
Insulation resistance between “Control circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” and “Control ground circuit of A/F sensor (bank-1) heater” is infinity.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wiring harness.

testgroup.title: A/F sensor heater check

test1.ptxt: Check heater resistance of A/F sensor (bank-1) referring to Air Fuel Ratio (A/F) Sensor On-Vehicle Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is A/F sensor heater in good condition?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.
